title: Fitch just downgraded the U.S. credit rating — how much does it matter?
description: The U.S. is no longer rated at the top-notch AAA by Fitch. Here's what credit ratings are, and why they (mostly) matter.

title: Former dancers accuse Lizzo of harassment and creating a hostile work environment
description: Court documents detail two years of disturbing allegations made against the four-time Grammy winning artist, who has become an international figure in part for championing women and body positivity.

title: Trump's attorney tells NPR how he plans to defend against the latest charges
description: One of Donald Trump's attorneys, John Lauro, outlines what he says is a 'very straightforward' defense against the latest charges against the former president.

title: With Brazil's exit, Marta delivers an emotional farewell to the World Cup
description: "For them, it's just the beginning. For me, it's the end of the line now," said Marta after her team's tie with Jamaica. She holds the record for most World Cup goals scored by a man or woman.

title: Latest Trump indictment could lead to even more disruption in the House
description: New York Times congressional correspondent Annie Karni says if Republicans choose to retaliate, and not pass spending bills, it could cause a government shutdown this fall.

title: What is a 'fire whirl,' the rare weather phenomenon spotted in a California wildfire
description: Firefighters recently spotted the spinning columns of flames as they battled the York Fire along the California-Nevada border.

title: This 18-year-old Colombian survived cancer. Now she's the World Cup star
description: After surviving cancer and signing to Real Madrid, Linda Caicedo is making her mark at the World Cup. The 18-year-old player already scored a goal in each of Colombia's first two matches.

title: Doctors have their own diagnosis: 'Moral distress' from an inhumane health system
description: A term coined to evoke the torment felt by soldiers as they process the cruelty of war, it's now used by doctors to describe the guilt and helplessness we feel when patients can't access needed care.

title: Missed last night's supermoon? Check out these stellar images from around the world
description: Photographers across the globe capitalized on last night's lunar event, delivering out of this world images of the sturgeon supermoon.

title: Movie extras worry they'll be replaced by AI. Hollywood is already doing body scans
description: Five background actors told NPR they had to undergo face and body digital scans while on TV and movie sets. The use of digital replicas is a sticking point in the ongoing strikes in Hollywood.

title: China floods have left at least 20 dead
description: Beijing's rainfall is the heaviest recorded in 140 years, reaching nearly 30 inches between Saturday and Wednesday. The downpours have triggered landslides and floods. Thousands have been evacuated.

title: Up First briefing: Trump's 3rd indictment; U.S. loses AAA rating; heat and the brain
description: Donald Trump is indicted on felony charges related to efforts to overturn the 2020 election. Fitch Ratings downgrades the U.S. credit rating. This is your brain on heat.

title: Amazon may have met its match in the grocery aisles
description: Amazon laid off workers at its brick-and-mortar grocery stores last week — the latest sign of the e-commerce giant's struggles to stand out in the competitive grocery landscape.

title: Cancer risk can lurk in our genes. So why don't more people get tested?
description: Millions of people in the U.S. have a genetic variant that raises their risk of cancer. Genetic testing can help people find cancer earlier and seek treatment. But many patients aren't offered it.

title: Earth to Voyager: NASA detects signal from spacecraft, two weeks after losing contact
description: The Jet Propulsion Lab lost contact with Voyager 2, which is traveling 12.3 billion miles away from Earth, after engineers mistakenly pointed its antenna 2 degrees away from its home planet.

title: 5 things to know about the latest charges against Donald Trump
description: Former President Donald Trump was indicted Tuesday on charges he led a web of conspiracies, with the ultimate goal of overturning the 2020 election results. Read this if you need to get up to speed.

title: Harris says she won't debate DeSantis on new Black history standards in Florida
description: In Orlando, Vice President Harris rejected Gov. Ron DeSantis' invitation for a discussion about the state's new curriculum on slavery, calling it an "unnecessary" debate.

title: Sales are way down at a Florida flea market. A new immigration law could be to blame.
description: Florida's new strict immigration law threatens the state's economy and could hurt political ambitions for some GOP candidates. Vendors at a popular flea market are already seeing the impacts.

title: The new CDC director outlines 3 steps to rebuild trust with the public
description: Mandy Cohen led North Carolina's department of Health & Human Services throughout the pandemic. Now, she's taking what she learned to the national level.

title: A wasted chance to fight addiction? Opioid settlement cash fills a local budget gap
description: State attorneys general vowed the funds would go toward tackling the addiction crisis. But as with the tobacco payouts of the 1990s, local officials have started using them to fill budget shortfalls.

title: Communities of faith welcome migrants caught in polarized immigration debate
description: When migrants from Latin America were flown from Texas and dropped off in Sacramento with nowhere to go, a group of congregations came together to care for them.

title: Foreign nationals are evacuating Niger as regional tensions rise
description: France, Italy and Spain announced evacuations for their citizens and other Europeans. The U.S. has yet to announce evacuation plans for Americans but some have left the with the help of the Europeans.

title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to $1.25 billion after no one hits the top prize
description: Tuesday night's drawing was the 30th straight without a winner. The lottery drought is due to poor luck and terrible odds: the chance of winning the Mega Millions jackpot is 1 in 302.6 million.

title: 1 person dies, 8 others are seriously hurt in tour bus rollover at Grand Canyon West
description: One person was killed in a tour bus rollover involving over 50 people Tuesday in northern Arizona near the Grand Canyon West Skywalk, authorities said.

title: Aid efforts for Haitians suffer blow with kidnapping of American nurse and daughter
description: Gang warfare has increasingly plagued Haiti since the 2021 assassination of President Jovenel Moïse. Criminal control has worsened and today the innocent are often killed, raped and held for ransom.

title: The charges facing Trump in the Jan. 6 investigation, explained
description: Trump was charged with conspiracy to defraud the United States, witness tampering, conspiracy against the rights of citizens, and obstruction of and attempt to obstruct an official proceeding.

title: The U.S. loses its top AAA rating from Fitch over worries about the nation's finances
description: Fitch cut the federal government's top rating, citing rising deficits and a steady deterioration in governance over the last two decades. The action drew a sharp rebuke from the Biden administration.
